uk.co.caprica.vlcj.component

Class DirectMediaPlayerComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.caprica.vlcj.component.DirectMediaPlayerComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderCallback, MediaPlayerEventListener

    public class DirectMediaPlayerComponent
extends Object
implements MediaPlayerEventListener, RenderCallback
    Encapsulation of a direct-rendering media player.

    The default behaviour is to provide the video data via the display(DirectMediaPlayer, Memory[], BufferFormat) method.

    Sub-classes may override this method to implement their own processing, or alternately return an implementation of a RenderCallback by overriding the onGetRenderCallback() template method.

    An example: 

     mediaPlayerComponent = new DirectMediaPlayerComponent() {

     protected String[] onGetMediaPlayerFactoryArgs() { return new String[] {"--no-video-title-show"}; }

     public void videoOutputAvailable(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer, boolean videoOutput) { }

     public void error(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer) { }

     public void finished(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer) { }

     public void display(DirectMediaPlayer mediaPlayer, Memory[] nativeBuffers, BufferFormat bufferFormat) { // Do something with the native video memory... }
 };
    When the media player component is no longer needed, it should be released by invoking the release() method.

    Since the media player factory associated by this component may be created by this component itself or may be shared with some other media player resources it is the responsibility of the application to also release the media player factory at the appropriate time.

        height - video height
        pitch - video pitch (also known as "stride")

    • Method Detail

      • getMediaPlayerFactory

        public final MediaPlayerFactory getMediaPlayerFactory()
        Get the media player factory reference.
        Returns:
        media player factory

      • getMediaPlayer

        public final DirectMediaPlayer getMediaPlayer()
        Get the direct media player reference.

        An application uses this handle to control the media player, add listeners and so on.

        Returns:
        media player

      • release

        public final void release()
        Release the media player component and the associated native media player resources.

        The associated media player factory will not be released, the client application is responsible for releasing the factory at the appropriate time.

        The end of the media sub-items was reached.
